result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Lee Meyer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County Case 14CF188

miscConds.notes:
Not possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Not enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.
Enter and complete any correctional programming deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Not to associate with any known drug dealers or users. 
Pay all court costs/fines associated with these cases.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pierce County Case 14CF88 and St Croix Case 15CF99
Defendant is eligible for CIP and any other substance abuse programming in prison.

records.addlTxt: 3:38 Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF188 heard at this time. Thorie: 1 year jail on 14CF173 and 14CF188, concurrent with each other and with St Croix County. Atty Stormont argues sentencing; joint agreement to 1 year jail concurrent.  Def addresses the court. Credit 165 days on each case.  Court: 1 year jail on 14CF173 and 14CF188, concurrent with each other and with the St Croix County case. Credit with 165 days  on both cases. (15cF99 St Croix County Case) Eligible for CIP and any substance abuse programming in prison.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 14CF188.  Thorie - reviewed PSI - probation for 3 years, concurrent on both cases, conditions as set forth in PSI, conditional jail time - 90 day recommendation.  Loberg - in agreement with 3 years probation and conditional jail.  Meyer addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Court orders S/W, 3 years probation concurrent on both cases, all conditions as set forth in PSI, DNA sample and surcharge.  $515 court costs including DNA surcharge on one case, court costs of $265 on other case, 90 days jail commencing immediately.  Appeal rights given to defendant.
Sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 10:30 am
